briefdescription.para: PocketSphinx speech recognizer object.
PocketSphinx N-best hypothesis iterator object.
PocketSphinx segmentation iterator object.
Sets default grammar and language model if they are not set explicitly and are present in the default search path.
Initialize the decoder from a configuration object.

simplesect.para: The decoder retains ownership of the pointer config, so if you are not going to use it elsewere, you can free it.

parameterdescription.para: a command-line structure, as created by cmd_ln_parse_r() or cmd_ln_parse_file_r().

briefdescription.para: Reinitialize the decoder with updated configuration.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows you to switch the acoustic model, dictionary, or other configuration without creating an entirely new decoding object.

simplesect.para: The decoder retains ownership of the pointer config, so you must not attempt to free it manually. If you wish to reuse it elsewhere, call cmd_ln_retain() on it.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder.
An optional new configuration to use. If this is NULL, the previous configuration will be reloaded, with any changes applied.

simplesect.para: 0 for success, <0 for failure.

briefdescription.para: Returns the argument definitions used in ps_init().

detaileddescription.para: This is here to avoid exporting global data, which is problematic on Win32 and Symbian (and possibly other platforms).

briefdescription.para: Retain a pointer to the decoder.

detaileddescription.para: This increments the reference count on the decoder, allowing it to be shared between multiple parent objects. In general you will not need to use this function, ever. It is mainly here for the convenience of scripting language bindings.

simplesect.para: pointer to retained decoder.

briefdescription.para: Finalize the decoder.

detaileddescription.para: This releases all resources associated with the decoder, including any language models or grammars which have been added to it, and the initial configuration object passed to ps_init().

parameterdescription.para: Decoder to be freed.

simplesect.para: New reference count (0 if freed).

briefdescription.para: Get the configuration object for this decoder.

simplesect.para: The configuration object for this decoder. The decoder retains ownership of this pointer, so you should not attempt to free it manually. Use cmd_ln_retain() if you wish to reuse it elsewhere.

briefdescription.para: Get the log-math computation object for this decoder.

simplesect.para: The log-math object for this decoder. The decoder retains ownership of this pointer, so you should not attempt to free it manually. Use logmath_retain() if you wish to reuse it elsewhere.

briefdescription.para: Get the feature extraction object for this decoder.

simplesect.para: The feature extraction object for this decoder. The decoder retains ownership of this pointer, so you should not attempt to free it manually. Use fe_retain() if you wish to reuse it elsewhere.

briefdescription.para: Get the dynamic feature computation object for this decoder.

simplesect.para: The dynamic feature computation object for this decoder. The decoder retains ownership of this pointer, so you should not attempt to free it manually. Use feat_retain() if you wish to reuse it elsewhere.

briefdescription.para: Adapt current acoustic model using a linear transform.

parameterdescription.para: The new transform to use, or NULL to update the existing transform. The decoder retains ownership of this pointer, so you should not attempt to free it manually. Use ps_mllr_retain() if you wish to reuse it elsewhere.

simplesect.para: The updated transform object for this decoder, or NULL on failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (ps_decoder_t *ps, char const *dictfile, char const *fdictfile, char const *format)
memberdef.name: ps_load_dict

briefdescription.para: Reload the pronunciation dictionary from a file.

detaileddescription.para: This function replaces the current pronunciation dictionary with the one stored in dictfile. This also causes the active search module(s) to be reinitialized, in the same manner as calling ps_add_word() with update=TRUE.

parameterdescription.para: Path to dictionary file to load.
Path to filler dictionary to load, or NULL to keep the existing filler dictionary.
Format of the dictionary file, or NULL to determine automatically (currently unused,should be NULL)

briefdescription.para: Dump the current pronunciation dictionary to a file.

detaileddescription.para: This function dumps the current pronunciation dictionary to a tex

parameterdescription.para: Path to file where dictionary will be written.
Format of the dictionary file, or NULL for the default (text) format (currently unused, should be NULL)

memberdef.argsstring: (ps_decoder_t *ps, char const *word, char const *phones, int update)
memberdef.name: ps_add_word

briefdescription.para: Add a word to the pronunciation dictionary.

detaileddescription.para: This function adds a word to the pronunciation dictionary and the current language model (but, obviously, not to the current FSG if FSG mode is enabled). If the word is already present in one or the other, it does whatever is necessary to ensure that the word can be recognized.

parameterdescription.para: Word string to add.
Whitespace-separated list of phoneme strings describing pronunciation of word.
If TRUE, update the search module (whichever one is currently active) to recognize the newly added word. If adding multiple words, it is more efficient to pass FALSE here in all but the last word.

simplesect.para: The internal ID (>= 0) of the newly added word, or <0 on failure.

briefdescription.para: Lookup for the word in the dictionary and return phone transcription for it.

parameterdescription.para: Pocketsphinx decoder
Word to look for

simplesect.para: Whitespace-spearated phone string describing the pronunciation of the word or NULL if word is not present in the dictionary. The string is allocated and must be freed by the user.

briefdescription.para: Decode a raw audio stream.

detaileddescription.para: No headers are recognized in this files. The configuration parameters -samprate and -input_endian are used to determine the sampling rate and endianness of the stream, respectively. Audio is always assumed to be 16-bit signed PCM.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder.
Previously opened file stream.
Maximum number of samples to read from rawfh, or -1 to read until end-of-file.

simplesect.para: Number of samples of audio.

briefdescription.para: Decode a senone score dump file.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder
Previously opened file handle positioned at start of file.

simplesect.para: Number of frames read.

briefdescription.para: Start processing of the stream of speech.

detaileddescription.para: Channel parameters like noise-level are maintained for the stream and reused among utterances. Times returned in segment iterators are also stream-wide.

simplesect.para: 0 for success, <0 on error.

briefdescription.para: Start utterance processing.

detaileddescription.para: This function should be called before any utterance data is passed to the decoder. It marks the start of a new utterance and reinitializes internal data structures.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder to be started.

simplesect.para: 0 for success, <0 on error.

memberdef.argsstring: (ps_decoder_t *ps, int16 const *data, size_t n_samples, int no_search, int full_utt)
memberdef.name: ps_process_raw

briefdescription.para: Decode raw audio data.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder.
If non-zero, perform feature extraction but don't do any recognition yet. This may be necessary if your processor has trouble doing recognition in real-time.
If non-zero, this block of data is a full utterance worth of data. This may allow the recognizer to produce more accurate results.

simplesect.para: Number of frames of data searched, or <0 for error.

memberdef.argsstring: (ps_decoder_t *ps, mfcc_t **data, int n_frames, int no_search, int full_utt)
memberdef.name: ps_process_cep

briefdescription.para: Decode acoustic feature data.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder.
If non-zero, perform feature extraction but don't do any recognition yet. This may be necessary if your processor has trouble doing recognition in real-time.
If non-zero, this block of data is a full utterance worth of data. This may allow the recognizer to produce more accurate results.

simplesect.para: Number of frames of data searched, or <0 for error.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of frames of data searched.

detaileddescription.para: Note that there is a delay between this and the number of frames of audio which have been input to the system. This is due to the fact that acoustic features are computed using a sliding window of audio, and dynamic features are computed over a sliding window of acoustic features.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder.

simplesect.para: Number of frames of speech data which have been recognized so far.

briefdescription.para: End utterance processing.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder.

simplesect.para: 0 for success, <0 on error

briefdescription.para: Get hypothesis string and path score.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder.
Output: path score corresponding to returned string.

simplesect.para: String containing best hypothesis at this point in decoding. NULL if no hypothesis is available.

briefdescription.para: Get hypothesis string and final flag.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder.
Output: if hypothesis is reached final state in the grammar.

simplesect.para: String containing best hypothesis at this point in decoding. NULL if no hypothesis is available.

briefdescription.para: Get posterior probability.

simplesect.para: Unless the -bestpath option is enabled, this function will always return zero (corresponding to a posterior probability of 1.0). Even if -bestpath is enabled, it will also return zero when called on a partial result. Ongoing research into effective confidence annotation for partial hypotheses may result in these restrictions being lifted in future versions.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder.

simplesect.para: Posterior probability of the best hypothesis.

briefdescription.para: Get word lattice.

detaileddescription.para: There isn't much you can do with this so far, a public API will appear in the future.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder.

simplesect.para: Word lattice object containing all hypotheses so far. NULL if no hypotheses are available. This pointer is owned by the decoder and you should not attempt to free it manually. It is only valid until the next utterance, unless you use ps_lattice_retain() to retain it.

briefdescription.para: Get an iterator over the word segmentation for the best hypothesis.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder.
Output: path score corresponding to hypothesis.

simplesect.para: Iterator over the best hypothesis at this point in decoding. NULL if no hypothesis is available.

briefdescription.para: Get the next segment in a word segmentation.

parameterdescription.para: Segment iterator.

simplesect.para: Updated iterator with the next segment. NULL at end of utterance (the iterator will be freed in this case).

briefdescription.para: Get word string from a segmentation iterator.

parameterdescription.para: Segment iterator.

simplesect.para: Read-only string giving string name of this segment. This is only valid until the next call to ps_seg_next().

briefdescription.para: Get inclusive start and end frames from a segmentation iterator.

simplesect.para: These frame numbers are inclusive, i.e. the end frame refers to the last frame in which the given word or other segment was active. Therefore, the actual duration is *out_ef - *out_sf + 1.

parameterdescription.para: Segment iterator.
Output: First frame index in segment.
Output: Last frame index in segment.

briefdescription.para: Get language, acoustic, and posterior probabilities from a segmentation iterator.

simplesect.para: Unless the -bestpath option is enabled, this function will always return zero (corresponding to a posterior probability of 1.0). Even if -bestpath is enabled, it will also return zero when called on a partial result. Ongoing research into effective confidence annotation for partial hypotheses may result in these restrictions being lifted in future versions.

parameterdescription.para: Output: acoustic model score for this segment.
Output: language model score for this segment.
Output: language model backoff mode for this segment (i.e. the number of words used in calculating lscr). This field is, of course, only meaningful for N-Gram models.

simplesect.para: Log posterior probability of current segment. Log is expressed in the log-base used in the decoder. To convert to linear floating-point, use logmath_exp(ps_get_logmath(), pprob).

briefdescription.para: Finish iterating over a word segmentation early, freeing resources.

memberdef.argsstring: (ps_decoder_t *ps, int sf, int ef, char const *ctx1, char const *ctx2)
memberdef.name: ps_nbest

briefdescription.para: Get an iterator over the best hypotheses, optionally within a selected region of the utterance.

detaileddescription.para: Iterator is empty now, it must be advanced with ps_nbest_next first. The function may also return a NULL which means that there is no hypothesis available for this utterance.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder.
Start frame for N-best search (0 for whole utterance)
End frame for N-best search (-1 for whole utterance)
First word of trigram context (NULL for whole utterance)
First word of trigram context (NULL for whole utterance)

simplesect.para: Iterator over N-best hypotheses or NULL if no hypothesis is available

briefdescription.para: Move an N-best list iterator forward.

parameterdescription.para: N-best iterator.

simplesect.para: Updated N-best iterator, or NULL if no more hypotheses are available (iterator is freed ni this case).

briefdescription.para: Get the hypothesis string from an N-best list iterator.

parameterdescription.para: N-best iterator.
Output: Path score for this hypothesis.

simplesect.para: String containing next best hypothesis.

briefdescription.para: Get the word segmentation from an N-best list iterator.

parameterdescription.para: N-best iterator.
Output: Path score for this hypothesis.

simplesect.para: Iterator over the next best hypothesis.

briefdescription.para: Finish N-best search early, releasing resources.

parameterdescription.para: N-best iterator.

briefdescription.para: Get performance information for the current utterance.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder.
Output: Number of seconds of speech.
Output: Number of seconds of CPU time used.
Output: Number of seconds of wall time used.

briefdescription.para: Get overall performance information.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder.
Output: Number of seconds of speech.
Output: Number of seconds of CPU time used.
Output: Number of seconds of wall time used.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the last feed audio buffer contained speech.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder.

simplesect.para: 1 if last buffer contained speech, 0 - otherwise

briefdescription.para: Sets the limit of the raw audio data to store in decoder to retrieve it later on ps_get_rawdata.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder
bytes of the utterance to store

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the raw data collected during utterance decoding.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder
preallocated buffer to store the data, must be within the limit set before
size of the data collected in samples (not bytes).

briefdescription.para: Main header file for the PocketSphinx decoder.
